description: From late Middle English, borrowed from Late Latin extensÄ«vus, from Latin extensus.

adjectives.description: extensive (comparative more extensive, superlative most extensive)

entries.meaning: Having a great extent; covering a large area; vast.

examples: I have done extensive research on the subject.

entries.meaning: Serving to extend or lengthen; characterized by extension.
(physics) Having a combined system entropy that equals the sum of the entropies of the independent systems.
